alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Lewis and Clark; Meagher (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 1:42PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lewis and Clark, northern Broadwater, northwestern Meagher and southwestern Cascade Counties through 230 PM MDT... At 141 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near East Helena, or 11 miles east of Helena, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... York, Fort Logan On The Smith River and Black Sandy State Park. This includes Highway 12 between mile markers 52 and 54. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. If on or near Hauser Lake, the north end of Canyon Ferry Reservoir or Lake Helena, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
